Description: Terracotta figure of Isis. A large figure of ‘Isis-Aphrodite anasyr(o)mene’, perhaps Isis-Bubastis, holding up the front of her tunic to show her pubic area; the back of the garment falls in curved folds of drapery beside her legs. She stands on a small, roundfronted, inadequate plinth. Her hair is parted in the middle and Isis-locks fall onto her shoulders; she wears large earrings and an enormous wreath with decorative elements, including discs with raised points, bound across the front with a narrow horizontal garland tied at each side; leaves fall beside her upper arms, below these leaves hang wide ribbons from the headdress. From the top of the wreath rises a large flaring kalathos, decorated with long tongues or petals and an Isis/Hathor-crown of cow’s horns, disc and feathers. The back is largely plain, with summary incuse indications, formed in the mould, of drapery low down, a horizontal jog at the lower level of the headdress, and a small circular vent, slightly off centre. A few traces of a white dressing on the front and red paint on headdress. Hollow, made in a two-piece mould, with a vent in the back. Orange-brown Nile Delta silt fabric with a red-brown surface and abundant gold mica , quartz and some white inclusions. Broken in half, and repaired recently.
Curator's comments: Her hands, while holding up the tunic (which has short sleeves), are in the same pose as the naked Hathor figures discussed by Bailey (2008, nos 2991–3000, also in the British Museum). Parallel dated first half of first century AD (head and shoulder fragment without a kalathos, Philipp 1972, figs 19 and 20). Close parallels perhaps from Naukratis (Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge E.P.233) and from Luxor (Christie’s Sale Catalogue, 8 December 1993, lot 95). Similar pieces from Egypt (Dunand 1973, pl. 21) and Mellawi in Middle Egypt (Perdrizet 1921, no. 157). This example is published in varios volumes (Walters 1903, C575; Bailey 2008, 3007; Pagenstecher 1923, 115, fig. 121; Fischer 1994, 332, no. 816). Dunand, F. 1973, Le Culte d'Isis dans le bassin oriental de la méditerranée, vol. 1: Le Culte d'Isis et les Ptolémées, Leiden. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Pagenstecher, R. 1923, Die griechisch-ägyptische Sammlung Ernst von Sieglin, part 1A: Malerei und Plastik, Leipzig. Perdrizet, P. 1921, Les Terres cuites grecques d’Égypte de la collection Fouquet, Nancy. Philipp, H. 1972, Terrakotten aus Ägypten im ägyptischen Museum Berlin. Berlin.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C575)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.130) (Phase 1)
